words.definition: If something is accurate, it is completely correct.
words.example: The story in the newspaper wasn’t very accurate.

words.definition: To analyze something is to study it carefully.
words.example: The scientist will analyze the blood sample.

words.definition: An asteroid is a giant rock from outer space.
words.example: In 1908, a giant asteroid hit Siberia.

words.definition: A controversy is a dispute about something that affects many people.
words.example: There has been a lot of controversy over the judge’s decision.

words.definition: To evolve is to change and develop over a long period of time.
words.example: Birds evolved from a certain type of dinosaur.

words.definition: A factor is something that affects a situation or result.
words.example: Weather is a major factor in our decision to go on a picnic.

words.definition: If something is genetic, it is related to genes or heredity.
words.example: The disease is genetic and can be passed to children.

words.definition: A genome is the complete set of genetic material in a living thing.
words.example: Scientists have mapped the entire human genome.

words.definition: To be identical is to be exactly the same.
words.example: The twin sisters are identical in every way.

words.definition: Related to the ability to think and understand things.
words.example: She is an intellectual who enjoys discussing philosophy.

words.definition: A majority is more than half of a total number.
words.example: The majority of the people voted for the new law.

words.definition: A mammal is an animal that feeds its babies with milk.
words.example: Whales and dolphins are mammals that live in the ocean.

words.definition: To multiply is to increase in number by a large amount.
words.example: Bacteria can multiply very quickly in warm conditions.

words.definition: Offspring are the young of a person, animal, or plant.
words.example: The lioness protected her offspring from danger.

words.definition: A pesticide is a chemical used to kill insects that damage crops.
words.example: The farmer used a pesticide to protect his corn.

words.definition: To regulate means to control something with rules or laws.
words.example: The government regulates the amount of pollution from factories.

words.definition: To reinforce something is to make it stronger.
words.example: The soldiers reinforced the walls of the fort.

words.definition: If someone is stricken by something, they are badly affected by it.
words.example: The area was stricken by a severe drought.

words.definition: If something is vast, it is very large or huge.
words.example: The desert is a vast area of sand and rocks.

words.definition: A person who does not eat meat.
words.example: She became a vegetarian because she loves animals.
